ai-iti109:1.1_0: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti109:2.1_0: “Suppose a person was being carried along by a river current that seemed nice and pleasant.
ai-iti109:2.2_0: If a person with good eyesight saw them, they’d say:
ai-iti109:2.3_0: ‘Mister, even though the river current carrying you along seems nice and pleasant, downstream there is a lake with waves and whirlpools, sharks and monsters. When you reach there it will result in death or deadly pain.’
ai-iti109:2.4_0: Then that person would hear that sound with their hands and feet,
ai-iti109:3.1_0: I’ve made up this simile to make a point.
ai-iti109:4.1_0: ‘Seeming nice and pleasant’ is a term for the six interior sense fields.
ai-iti109:5.1_0: ‘A downstream lake’ is a term for the five lower fetters.
ai-iti109:6.1_0: ‘Danger of fear’ is a term for anger and distress.
ai-iti109:7.1_0: ‘Whirlpool’ is a term for the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-iti109:8.1_0: ‘Sharks and monsters’ is a term for females.
ai-iti109:9.1_0: ‘Against the stream’ is a term for renunciation.
ai-iti109:10.1_0: ‘Paddling with hands and feet’ is a term for being energetic.
ai-iti109:11.1_0: ‘Standing about the eye’ is a term for the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.”
ai-iti109:11.2_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-iti109:12.3_0: with deep understanding and heart well-freed,
ai-iti109:12.4_0: Herein, freedom contact is the means of contact.
ai-iti109:12.5_0: they’ve completed the spiritual journey, and gone to the end of the world,
ai-iti109:12.6_0: they’re called ‘one who has gone beyond’.”
ai-iti109:13.1_0: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
